step.reason: \text{Let }x+2 = t^2 \implies dx = 2t\, dt\\ \text{Now }\underbrace{t^2 = 2}_{t = \sqrt{2}}\text{ when }x = 0 \text{ and }\underbrace{t^2 = 4}_{t = 2}\text{ when }x=2\\ \begin{align} \therefore A &= \int_{0}^{2} x\sqrt{x +2}\, dx\\ &= \int_{\sqrt{2}}^{2}\left(\underbrace{t^2 - 2}_{x}\right)\cdot \underbrace{t}_{\sqrt{x+2}}\cdot \underbrace{2t\, dt}_{dx}\\ &=2\int_{\sqrt{2}}^{2} \left(t^4 - 2t^2\right)\, dt \end{align}
